cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select features and target
features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[features]
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Fill NaN values with median of each feature
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(test_data.median(), inplace=True)

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[features])

# Train linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop non-numerical columns and select features and target
features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[features].dropna()
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].dropna()

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[features].fillna(0))

# Train linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select numerical features and target
numerical_features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].median())
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].fillna(train_data['SalePrice'].median())

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].median()))

# Train linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select numerical features
numerical_features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[numerical_features].dropna()
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].dropna()

# Fill missing values in the target variable with its median
y_train_median = y_train.median()
y_train_filled = y_train.fillna(y_train_median)
X_train_filled = X_train.fillna(X_train.median())

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_filled)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[numerical_features].fillna(X_train.median()))

# Train linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train_filled)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select numerical features and target
numerical_features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].median())
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].fillna(train_data['SalePrice'].median())

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].median()))

    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select numerical features and target
numerical_features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[numerical_features].dropna()
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].dropna()

# Fill missing values in the target variable with its median
y_train_median = y_train.median()
y_train_filled = y_train.fillna(y_train_median)
X_train_filled = X_train.fillna(X_train.median())

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_filled)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].median()))

# Train Decision Tree Regressor model
model = DecisionTreeRegressor(random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train_filled)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select numerical features and target
numerical_features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].mean())
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].fillna(train_data['SalePrice'].mean())

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].mean()))

# Train linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select numerical features and target
numerical_features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea', 'TotalBsmtSF']
X_train = train_data[numerical_features].dropna()
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].dropna()

# Fill missing values in the target variable with its mean
y_train_mean = y_train.mean()
y_train_filled = y_train.fillna(y_train_mean)
X_train_filled = X_train.fillna(X_train.mean())

# Standardize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train_filled)
test_data_scaled = scaler.transform(test_data[numerical_features].fillna(train_data[numerical_features].mean()))

# Train linear regression model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train_filled)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_data_scaled)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_data['Id'],
    'SalePrice': predictions
})

# Save submission CSV
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
